div.div: Terry Pratchett quotes not only for Dummies

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Terry Pratchett quotes not only for Dummies

Just shortly after Terry Pratchett died, his last book "Shepherd" was published. I have never read it. Why? I just wanted to have one of his novels ready to read on my shelf and I knew he will never write any sentence more.
“Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you.”
The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.

Why do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving.
Sometimes glass glitters more than diamonds because it has more to prove.
A marriage is always made up of two people who are prepared to swear that only the other one snores.
All tapes left in a car for more than about a fortnight metamorphose into Best of Queen albums.
If cats looked like frogs we’d realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That’s what people remember.
Real stupidity beats artificial intelligence every time.

section.p: ..inside every old person is a young person wondering what happened
People think that stories are shaped by people. In fact, it's the other way around.
